page.title: 14POPULATION CHANGES,LYDART
page.content: Unlike some rural regions we are not suffering from depopulation but from 'deruralisation'. People born in this locality cannot find jobs and have to move to towns; small cottages become empty and are bought by young,well- paid executives who commute to the nearby towns of Bristol,Cardiff and Newport. The new country dwellers are likely to be approaching middle-age with children beyond primary school age,so the village school in Penallt is due to be closed soon. Many houses are bought by retired city people,leaving none cheap enough for first time buyers,thus creating a bias towards the elderly or wealthy. Most families have private transport, so bus services may be withdrawn,the village shop has closed,and we are rapidly becoming a commuter community.
